front.title: A TLS/DTLS 1.2 Profile for the Internet of Things

abstract.t: A common design pattern in Internet of Things (IoT) deployments is the use of a constrained device (typically providing sensor data) that makes data available for home automation, industrial control systems, smart cities and other IoT deployments. This document defines a Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Datagram TLS 1.2 profile that offers communications security for this data exchange thereby preventing eavesdropping, tampering, and message forgery.
